sentences: Robert James Marquinez Reid (born 11 May 1993) is a Filipino-Australian singer-songwriter, actor, dancer, model, record producer and record label executive.
section: N/A

sentences: He began his professional acting career in the early 2010s after being named as Big Winner of Pinoy Big Brother: Teen Clash 2010.
section: N/A

sentences: He came into prominence for his leading role in the film Diary ng Panget (2014).
section: N/A

sentences: Reid has since starred in Philippines movies, such as Talk Back
section: N/A

sentences: and You're Dead (2014), Para sa Hopeless Romantic (2015), This Time (2016) and Never Not Love You (2018).
section: N/A

sentences: He also starred in the Philippine TV series Good Vibes (2011), On the Wings of Love (2015–16), and Till I Met You (2016–17).
section: N/A

sentences: Reid has released one studio album: Palm Dreams (2017), which was his first self-produced album under his own record label, Careless; and three extended plays: We Are Whatever (2011) with Bret Jackson, the self-titled album James Reid (2013) and the gold record Reid Alert (2015).

== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Reid was born as Robert James Reid in Sydney, Australia, on 11 May 1993 to an Australian father and a Filipino mother.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He has four half-brothers and two half-sisters from his father's side, and one half-sister from his mother's side.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His parents separated when he was two years old, and Reid lived in Australia until he was fifteen.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: With his father, Reid moved to the Philippines due to financial issues.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Reid has stated before that he found it difficult to adjust to his new life in the Philippines, especially due to the different academic and social skills required, as well as language difficulties.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Back in Australia, he was a gymnast and swimmer.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He was enrolled in Makati Science High School, but his father enrolled him in Karabar High School Distance Education Centre, an Australian distance-learning center located in Karabar, New South Wales, Australia.
section: == Early life ==

== Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: Pinoy Big Brother =
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===
== Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: Reid was only 17 years old when he entered the Pinoy Big Brother house as one of the 10 "Teenternational" housemates on 30 April 2010 (Day 22).
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: He celebrated his 17th birthday inside the house with his co-teenternational housemates giving him a surprise pool party.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: Reid was the only teenternational housemate who had Filipino blood.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: Reid was almost evicted twice during his stay inside the house.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: The first one occurred on 21 May 2010 (Day 43) when Reid was brought to the hospital due to chest pains, discoloration, and shortness of breath while the second one happened on 1 June 2010 (Day 53), when he was again brought to the hospital for the same health issues but this time together with fellow housemate Angelo Pasco.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: At first, the doctors diagnosed Reid with costochondritis (muscle pains in the rib/chest area), but during his second visit at the hospital, the doctors found a hole in one of his lungs that is causing him difficulties in his breathing.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: After the complications, Reid was able to return to the Big Brother House, with conditions of having to rest frequently as well as wearing an oxygen tube for 1 week 24/7.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: One 8 June 2010 (Day 60), Reid was notified by the producers of Big Brother that he was no longer required to use the oxygen tube, he was only required to use it when he is sleeping.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: On 26 June 2010 (Day 78), he was crowned as the Pinoy Big Brother: Teen Clash 2010 Big Winner after receiving 179, 294 (19.75%) of the total votes just 1.05% ahead of the total votes received by the 2nd Teen Big Placer, Ryan Bang who got 169, 697 (18.70%) of the total votes, these mark as the closest race ever to become the Big Winner in the history of Pinoy Big Brother.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: As the Big Winner, Reid won P1,000,000 (plus the same amount to his chosen charity) from Jack n' Jill, a laptop computer from Sony Vaio, a 42-inch flat screen TV from Sony Bravia, an Asian tour package for two care of Von Dutch, P1,500,000 worth of bottled purified water business from Crystal Clear, and a condominium unit worth P3,000,000 courtesy of Globe Asiatique.
section: == Career == | === 2010: Pinoy Big Brother ===

sentences: In March 2017, it was confirmed that Reid's first studio album is entitled Palm Dreams.

sentences: Reid stated that he wrote all the tracks in the album alongside rapper and music producer, Paulo Tiongson.

section: == Career == | === 2017—present: Palm Dreams, MTV EMA Awards, Revolution, and other projects ===

sentences: The album was released on 8 July 2017 and marked the foundation of Reid's own independent record label, Careless.
section: == Career == | === 2017—present: Palm Dreams, MTV EMA Awards, Revolution, and other projects ===

sentences: Palm Dreams spawned two more singles; "Turning Up" and "The Life".

section: == Career == | === 2017—present: Palm Dreams, MTV EMA Awards, Revolution, and other projects ===

sentences: His performance in the film garnered him his second nomination for Outstanding Achievement By An Actor In a Leading Role at the 67th FAMAS Awards.
section: == Career == | === 2017—present: Palm Dreams, MTV EMA Awards, Revolution, and other projects ===

sentences: In August 2018, James starred  in a remake of the Korean film Miss Granny with Sarah Geromino in the title role.

sentences: Reid was also set to star in the new Pedro Penduko adaptation of Viva Films, which was based on the re-imagined version written by Regene Estolatan under Epik Studios.

section: == Career == | === 2017—present: Palm Dreams, MTV EMA Awards, Revolution, and other projects ===

section: == Career == | === 2017—present: Palm Dreams, MTV EMA Awards, Revolution, and other projects ===
